程序包 org.janusgraph.diskstorage.idmanagement

枚举 ConflictAvoidanceMode

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Enum<ConflictAvoidanceMode>
org.janusgraph.diskstorage.idmanagement.ConflictAvoidanceMode
所有已实现的接口:
Serializable, Comparable<ConflictAvoidanceMode>, java.lang.constant.Constable
public enum ConflictAvoidanceMode
extends Enum<ConflictAvoidanceMode>
Represents ID allocation strategies for avoiding contention between concurrent JanusGraph instances using a shared storage backend. These strategies are implemented in ConsistentKeyIDAuthority.

  • 嵌套类概要

    从类继承的嵌套类/接口 java.lang.Enum

    Enum.EnumDesc<E extends Enum<E>>

  • 枚举常量概要

    枚举常量
    枚举常量 说明
    GLOBAL_AUTO
    JanusGraph randomly selects a tag from the space of all possible tags when performing allocations.
    GLOBAL_MANUAL
    The user assigns a tag to each JanusGraph instance.
    LOCAL_MANUAL
    Expert feature: use with care. The user manually assigns each JanusGraph instance a unique conflict avoidance tag in its local graph configuration.
    NONE
    Disables ID allocation conflict avoidance.

  • 枚举常量详细资料

    • NONE

      public static final ConflictAvoidanceMode NONE
      Disables ID allocation conflict avoidance. This setting does not compromise correctness. However, in a clustered JanusGraph deployment, this may result in ID allocations frequently failing due to contention and then retrying, slowing overall write throughput.

    • LOCAL_MANUAL

      public static final ConflictAvoidanceMode LOCAL_MANUAL
      Expert feature: use with care. The user manually assigns each JanusGraph instance a unique conflict avoidance tag in its local graph configuration. The tag becomes part of globally-visible graph element IDs allocated by that JanusGraph instance. Each JanusGraph instance assumes it has exclusive control over its tag, and it uses datacenter-local-quorum-level consistency (on storage backends that support this concept) when allocating IDs with its tag.

      This is useful for reducing write latency in JanusGraph deployments atop a multi-datacenter distributed store.

      When this mode is set, the user is responsible for setting a unique tag in each JanusGraph graph configuration. Setting the same tag on two different JanusGraph configurations can lead to silent graph corruption in this mode! Each tag must be unique. If you're unsure about this or its implications, then use one of the other modes instead.

    • GLOBAL_MANUAL

      public static final ConflictAvoidanceMode GLOBAL_MANUAL
      The user assigns a tag to each JanusGraph instance. The tags should be globally unique for optimal performance, but duplicates will not compromise correctness. The tag becomes part of globally-visible graph element IDs allocated by the instance. If each instance has a unique tag, then ID allocations will never conflict.

      Unlike LOCAL_MANUAL, setting the same tag on multiple instances is safe in this mode. JanusGraph uses global-quorum-level or greater on storage backends that have a notion of eventual consistency, so JanusGraph will detect contention and avoid double allocation even when multiple instances share a tag.

    • GLOBAL_AUTO

      public static final ConflictAvoidanceMode GLOBAL_AUTO
      JanusGraph randomly selects a tag from the space of all possible tags when performing allocations. Like GLOBAL_MANUAL, this uses at least global-quorum-level consistency, so even if two instances happen to select the same ID simultaneously, the conflict will still be detected.
